text: What do we all reckon to this <https://betting.betfair.com/betfair-announcements/exchange-news/the-betfair-exchange-expert-fee-faq-111224-6.html>

elements.text: What do we all reckon to this

text: On first light read, not a lot to be honest. Might be wrong but I think I will be worse off - if only due to the reduction in implied commission from 3% to 2.5%. Sounds better for those paying over 40% PC currently though.

elements.text: On first light read, not a lot to be honest. Might be wrong but I think I will be worse off - if only due to the reduction in implied commission from 3% to 2.5%. Sounds better for those paying over 40% PC currently though.

text: I guess it's good news for anyone who has made over 250K lifetime and is stuck on 40%+ rate now but only makes less than 100K gross a year currently.

elements.text: I guess it's good news for anyone who has made over 250K lifetime and is stuck on 40%+ rate now but only makes less than 100K gross a year currently.

text: Ok I was wrong :joy:

elements.text: Ok I was wrong

text: Hmm, yeah the reduction in implied is annoying, just seems too little, too late

elements.text: Hmm, yeah the reduction in implied is annoying, just seems too little, too late

text: Genuinely curious as to what the rationale is behind this. The big boys are surely no better off under this unless they are already on more than 40% rate currently.

elements.text: Genuinely curious as to what the rationale is behind this. The big boys are surely no better off under this unless they are already on more than 40% rate currently.

text: Get some former users back on the exchange?

elements.text: Get some former users back on the exchange?

text: But it wouldn't serve as a "reset" due to the "active week" definition? Presumably if you'd left the site in protest you're still assessed by your last 52 active weeks. I guess we will easily see if it results in increased volumes during January.

elements.text: But it wouldn't serve as a "reset" due to the "active week" definition? Presumably if you'd left the site in protest you're still assessed by your last 52 active weeks. I guess we will easily see if it results in increased volumes during January.

text: Under the new scheme the only reason to want to pay more commission now is to take a chunk out of the PC.

text: <@UPMUFSGCR> if you make less than 25K/yr, yes. otherwise no as it's a rolling value.

text: From a quick read it’s terrible for those who structured things so they churn lots of commission? Time will tell and they may well attract former users back onto the platform but now there’s no incentive to provide liquidity to increase your implied commission. On top of that, if you only pay the commission rate these changes mean it will go up to potentially 40%. I only offer rather than take prices so there’s another liquidity leak

elements.text: From a quick read it’s terrible for those who structured things so they churn lots of commission? Time will tell and they may well attract former users back onto the platform but now there’s no incentive to provide liquidity to increase your implied commission.
On top of that, if you only pay the commission rate these changes mean it will go up to potentially 40%. I only offer rather than take prices so there’s another liquidity leak

text:
A distinction between making and taking would have been more interesting. I'll be worse off, due to a high lifetime comm ratio (deliberately so) I currently pay nothing. I'm also now incentivised to generate less commission than I was before from churning.

This will suit the manual trader/low comm generators as they'll avoid the top up to 20 or 40%, if you currently generate a lot of comm then it's less attractive.

elements.text:
A distinction between making and taking would have been more interesting. I'll be worse off, due to a high lifetime comm ratio (deliberately so) I currently pay nothing. I'm also now incentivised to generate less commission than I was before from churning.

This will suit the manual trader/low comm generators as they'll avoid the top up to 20 or 40%, if you currently generate a lot of comm then it's less attractive.

text: I don't pay PC, but gut instinct is I'm more likely to pay EF in the next few months with this. Happy to pay for the service.

text:
Yeah I don't see why this would change the behaviour of the only people who will benefit from this: reasonably profitable manual ladder traders who drop from 40% down to 20%. The more I look at it, the less it feels like a change - unless you already pay 50/60% OR you are a brand new sharp player who is going to be paying 40% rate 150K profit earlier than they would have prior to the change.

I guess we will see the real changes to the volume and liquidity soon enough though.

elements.text:

I guess we will see the real changes to the volume and liquidity soon enough though.
